<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> Susanne E. Hambrusch</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <IMG SRC="images/seh.gif"><P> <H1> Susanne E. Hambrusch</H1> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> <EM> Professor of Computer Sciences (1982)</EM><P> <EM> M.S., computer science, Technical University of Vienna, 1977; Ph.D., computer science, The Pennsylvania State University, 1982. </EM><P> Professor Hambrusch's research interests are in the area of parallel computation, scalable parallel systems and algorithms, image processing and computer vision, and analysis of algorithms. Her research contributions include parallel algorithms for image processing and graph problems, parallel models, communication operations for massively parallel machines, computational equivalence studies for interconnection networks, and algorithms for VLSI layout and routing problems. Dr. Hambrusch is a member of the Editorial Boards of <i>Parallel Computing</i> and <i>Information Processing Letters</i> and a member of the IEEE Technical Committee on Parallel Processing (TCPP). Dr. Hambrusch has held visiting positions at the International Computer Science Institute, Berkeley, and at the Technical University of Graz, Austria. <P> <i>Projects:</i> <ul> <li> <A HREF="../research/compvis.html">Parallel Scalable Libraries and Algorithms for Computer Vision</A> <li> <A HREF="../research/mber.html">Message Broadcasting and Edge Reductions</A> </ul> <P> <i>Honors and Awards:</i> <ul> <li> Outstanding Paper award at the 25th International Conference on Parallel Processing for her paper, <i>Scalable S-to-P Broadcasting on Message-Passing MPPs</i> </ul> <P> <A HREF="../publications/seh.html">Recent Publications</a> <P> <A HREF="http://www.cs.purdue.edu/people/seh"> Personal Homepage</A> <P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
</DOC>
